spirit_aatxe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_aatxe.spiritDescription: My life belongs to Mari. I am the rider of storms and keeper of Her earthly treasures.

spirit_abata.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Harvester. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Gathers nearby collectibles for its summoner. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_abata.spiritDescription: I am queen of the marshes. The black waters are my dominion. Old secrets lie with me.

spirit_abchanchu.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_abchanchu.spiritDescription: I am old and gouty handed. Come close and I will share the wisdom of my days.

spirit_abeonaAdeona.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Resurrector. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Resurrects its summoner and allies. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_abeonaAdeona.spiritDescription: As sisters, we serve as guardians of wayward souls. We hold dominion over departures and wandering and give comfort to lost children.

spirit_abiku.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_abiku.spiritDescription: Never sated, I drink your spirit with relish. Where I traverse pestilence follows.

spirit_abkaHehe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_abkaHehe.spiritDescription: I am the triple goddess, mother of earth and light. I give birth to spirits of light and live to cast the wicked from the earthly plane.

spirit_abnoba.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_abnoba.spiritDescription: Keeper of sacred springs and spirit of the deep forest. Born among the Celts I now travel the waters far and wide in the world.

spirit_acat.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_acat.spiritDescription: Long venerated by the Mayans, I am patron to the artists of the flesh.

spirit_accaLarentia.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_accaLarentia.spiritDescription: I am benefactress of my beloved Rome. A siren of the Seven Hills. Few spirits can match my wealth, none my beauty.

spirit_acheri.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_acheri.spiritDescription: The filth of mankind constitutes my life and my breath. I go as the child of innocent form, but my breath is disease.

spirit_aegir.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_aegir.spiritDescription: Primeval spirit of the sea, I was ancient when the earth still lived beneath the waves. I live to host and bring cheer to the halls of man and gods alike.

spirit_aeronwen.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_aeronwen.spiritDescription: From atop the old green hills I see the fate of battles before the first skull is cracked. I am a shield for those humble enough to call upon me.

spirit_aganyu.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_aganyu.spiritDescription: My beating heart is fashioned from the black soil. I am a primordial dweller in the deepest quarters of the earth, when I lift my breath the earth heaves.

spirit_agni.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_agni.spiritDescription: I am the Hindu God of Fire, Lightning, the Sun, and of Hearth. Perform a dance of fire in my honor and it will please me greatly.

spirit_agogwe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_agogwe.spiritDescription: You'll find me deep in the jungles of Africa. Some say I don't exist, and some say I do. It's up to you to find me and prove them wrong, or right.

spirit_agwe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_agwe.spiritDescription: I am the loa of the sea, and patron of the sailors. My waters are free for your exploration, given that you protect them as I do.

spirit_ahool.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Asia. </color>
spirit_ahool.spiritDescription: I ride the night winds on dusky wings. My cry is a call to the spirits of the night.

spirit_aife.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_aife.spiritDescription: I am shaman, sorceress and maiden of the sword and lance. My love is war. My rival is Scatach, though I am her better.

spirit_aine.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_aine.spiritDescription: My eyes are lit by the sun, the summer is my favored season, my bower is the sunlit glade.

spirit_alakshmi.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_alakshmi.spiritDescription: Don't confuse me with Lakshmi- I am the goddess of grief and despair. You won't have a happy experience if you encounter me.

spirit_alcyone.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_alcyone.spiritDescription: Like Aeronwen I see what has not yet come to pass. The black hyded raven is my familiar and the speaker of my fortunes.

spirit_altamaha.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_altamaha.spiritDescription: The base of the Altamaha River is my home. I live my life in secrecy and keep alive the legend of my existence.

spirit_aluqa.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_aluqa.spiritDescription: I and my daughters are leechers of life drawing upon blood and spirit alike. We crawl as the insect and seduce as the irresistable maiden.

spirit_amFear.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_amFear.spiritDescription: I am the big grey man that wanders the passes of Ben MacDhui. Those that fear me do not know me, for I am a watchman for the adventurers of my realm.

spirit_amberella.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Slavic Countries. </color>
spirit_amberella.spiritDescription: Once human, I am now the princess of the deep ocean. When I long to shore I will often leave gifts of amber in my wake.

spirit_ammit.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_ammit.spiritDescription: I am the devourer of the dead. I rest in the underworld, and feed off of the souls I call my meals.

spirit_andraste.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_andraste.spiritDescription: I am a bringer of luck, my presence is courage to the anxious. I was the wind behind Boudica's revolt. My devotees find victory in my inspiration.

spirit_angerboda.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_angerboda.spiritDescription: I delight in the mystery of my true nature, for few among man know me well. I am a friend to witches, and give my guidance when I please. I have been known to travel in crow form.

spirit_angerona.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_angerona.spiritDescription: I am protectress of Rome and keeper of her secrets, I shall hold her true name for eternity.

spirit_anhanga.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_anhanga.spiritDescription: I have known death, but death does not keep me. I can take many forms but favor the fire-eyed stag. I am only happy in wandering and sporting with frail human minds.

spirit_aoandon.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_aoandon.spiritDescription: One hundred blue lanterns burn against the night. I will walk the edge of the shadows until the last light is spent. Your fear is my delight.

spirit_apep.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_apep.spiritDescription: I am the bringer of chaos. The Underworld rumbles at the sound of my great roar, casting fear into the hearts of many.

spirit_apsara.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_apsara.spiritDescription: I am the dancer of the Gandharvas' music that echo deep in the gods' palaces. I provide entertainment and sometimes more to the magnificent.

spirit_ascalaphus.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_ascalaphus.spiritDescription: I once pressed the orchard grass with my bare feet, now I crawl among the rocks. Pleasure abounds in the touch of the earth.

spirit_attercroppe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_attercroppe.spiritDescription: I am the little poison head. My deeds are more mishief than malice. Upon my word, I promise good behavior.

spirit_aurora.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_aurora.spiritDescription: I am the spirit of the Northern Lights. People come to my domains to see my show and admire my gift of light.

spirit_austeja.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Slavic Countries. </color>
spirit_austeja.spiritDescription: I am protectress of bees and guardian of families. I especially watch over women-with-child. Honey is sacred to me.

spirit_axehandle.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_axehandle.spiritDescription: You'll find me wandering about in Minnesota and Wisconsin deep in the night. Be careful not to leave your axes out- you might find them handle-less by morning.

spirit_ayida.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_ayida.spiritDescription: I am the Rainbow Serpent, the loa of fertility, rainbows, wind, water, fire, and snakes. Offer me white eggs, rice, or milk and I will share with you my secrets.

spirit_ayizan.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_ayizan.spiritDescription: I am the loa of marketplace and commerce. I keep with my many secrets and mysteries, to that which I will share with those who serve the Vodou correctly.

spirit_azaka.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_azaka.spiritDescription: I am the loa of the harvest. I am a kind and gentle soul who loves to eat; come, share a meal with me.

spirit_babaYaga.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Slavic Countries. </color>
spirit_babaYaga.spiritDescription: I am no eater of children! They are far too stringy. My false reputation is owed to the deception of wicked step mothers, for I am a giver of justice and sharer of forest wisdom.

spirit_badbh.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_badbh.spiritDescription: I am the battle crow. I move easily between the realms of the living and the dead. I carry secrets of the otherworld, for a price.

spirit_bakeneko.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_bakeneko.spiritDescription: I am the silent feline. I am gentle, and you will hear the chirp of a cricket before you hear my approach.

spirit_bakru.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_bakru.spiritDescription: Made of flesh and yew, I am small but my heart is a clutch of flames. When I traffic among man I keep to passages and bridgeways.

spirit_baku.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_baku.spiritDescription: I am the eater of foul dreams. Try my name three times and I will drink the nightmares from your brain.

spirit_banamuHehe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_banamuHehe.spiritDescription: I am the Earth Mother. I form a triad with Abka Hehe and Ulden Hehe. Respect nature, and you will have my gratitude.

spirit_banaspati.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Asia. </color>
spirit_banaspati.spiritDescription: Red of flesh and sharp of horn, I draw my strength from the anger of mankind. I wear your anger like a wreath of flame.

spirit_banshee.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects allied witches in a Death state. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_banshee.spiritDescription: I am born of the green glens of my ancient homeland, a sleeper of the mound. I am a watcher of noble families and sometimes sing the secrets of the dead.

spirit_baobhanSith.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_baobhanSith.spiritDescription: I am come of the Scottish Highlands, but now journey the world over. The blood of huntsman is my drink of choice, his will is no match to my persuasion.

spirit_barghest.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_barghest.spiritDescription: I am a spectral hound loyal to my summoner. I will protect them with my life, and stay by their side at all times.

spirit_befana.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_befana.spiritDescription: I've been carrying gifts to the young since the ancient times. I keep my home in the forests of Italy.

spirit_begtse.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Asia. </color>
spirit_begtse.spiritDescription: I once rode as the lord of war spiriting the horde of Genghis Khan! I still serve as the guardian of Mongolia, but I'm always up for an adventure!

spirit_belenus.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_belenus.spiritDescription: Once beloved as a shining deity, I am enjoying an age of peaceful obscurity. I keep to my flocks in the sunlit meadows, but I may be called upon for spiritual errands.

spirit_belieBelcan.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_belieBelcan.spiritDescription: I am a shield to honorable witches and devoted to the service of my summoner.

spirit_benten.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_benten.spiritDescription: I am daughter of the dragon king. I dwell beneath Lake Biwa by Kyoto. If love is your purpose, I shall guide you.

spirit_bigfoot.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_bigfoot.spiritDescription: It is I, the legend itself. Some will see me wandering in the woods, some will mistake me, and some will say I do not exist. Only the wisest will know the truth.

spirit_boggart.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_boggart.spiritDescription: Mishcief is my game. I make my home in the houses of man. I may turn your milk or hobble your hound, but malicious? Never in life!

spirit_booHag.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_booHag.spiritDescription: I am the skinless skin thief. I often walk in others' skins, hiding my true raw self. My victims' breaths are my blood, giving me power and life.

spirit_boromu.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_boromu.spiritDescription: I am a lord of ash and desiccation. I am coughed from the stomachs of old gods. I bring withering and weakness upon mankind.

spirit_brockenSpectre.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_brockenSpectre.spiritDescription: I am the spirit of The Brocken. Let your eyes rest upon me and my form shall become a mirror of your soul.

spirit_bruxaEvora.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_bruxaEvora.spiritDescription: I am more wise and more beautiful than any living witch. I am a wellspring of mystic knowledge and will share secrets in return for adulation.

spirit_buda.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_buda.spiritDescription: I am the power of the Evil Eye. Often in the form of a hyena, I will stalk my victims and show them my true nature.

spirit_bunyip.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Harvester. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Gathers nearby collectibles for its summoner. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Oceania. </color>
spirit_bunyip.spiritDescription: I thrive in the dark waters of Australia. Rumors of my wicked nature are false, for I care little for the ways of man. For those few that I favor I will give protection.

spirit_caipora.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_caipora.spiritDescription: I prefer to keep to the shadowy fastness of the forests, turning my feet to trick my followers. While I have little concern for man, the right gift can earn my favor.

spirit_callisto.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_callisto.spiritDescription: In my spirit form I come as the bear. My voice is weak but my strength is formidable. Honey and sweets will bring out the best in my temperament.

spirit_camazotz.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Central America. </color>
spirit_camazotz.spiritDescription: I am the Snatch Bat, a black winged agent of death. The noble heroes of Maya were no match for me, what makes you think you'll have a chance?

spirit_catSidhe.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_catSidhe.spiritDescription: There can be no more gentle companion to witches. I am here to serve.

spirit_chantico.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_chantico.spiritDescription: The flames of time light my spirit. At rest, I take the form of the red serpent. I am a willing guardian of witches.

spirit_charities.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_charities.spiritDescription: I have served witches old and young for centuries. I am one of the noble Graces, but you need not be noble to win my favor.

spirit_chelone.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_chelone.spiritDescription: Once a nymph of the mountain passes, I now enjoy my days in the form of a turtle. Never interfere with the love affairs of gods.

spirit_choncon.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_choncon.spiritDescription: The span of my wings will conceal the stars above you as I hunt the moonless night, and as your loved ones slumber, I will nourish from their blood.

spirit_chthonian.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_chthonian.spiritDescription: I am a spirit of the earth, I prefer to keep my time upon the surface to a minimum.

spirit_chupacabra.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_chupacabra.spiritDescription: I was first sighted in Puerto Rico, then made my way to the United States to feed on the abundance of livestock. This has earned me the name "the goatsucker."

spirit_cindaku.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Asia. </color>
spirit_cindaku.spiritDescription: I have the mind of man and the form of the tiger. While my history with man has been turbulent, I will occasionally serve a capable witch with a good cause.

spirit_cipelahq.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_cipelahq.spiritDescription: I am the fierce eyed spirit of the night. I come as prince of owls, my cries cause mothers to hush their babes.

spirit_coventina.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_coventina.spiritDescription: I take my strength from the sacred springs of Northumberland. I owe my healing powers to these waters.

spirit_curupira.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_curupira.spiritDescription: I delight in the animals and plants of the wild, but perhaps I delight in confounding the axman, poacher, and those harmful the nature just a bit more.

spirit_dapperSkeleton.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_dapperSkeleton.spiritDescription: I am the mascot of the Day of the Dead. Although my origins are in Mexico, influence and culture has brought me around the globe to share my dapperness with all.

spirit_djab.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Caribbean. </color>
spirit_djab.spiritDescription: I am an unabashed spirit for hire, here to provide magical talents to the highest bidder.

spirit_djinn.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_djinn.spiritDescription: We are old and many, fashioned of flames we are masters of many forms. We are a moody race, let us hope that you've caught me at the right time.

spirit_dropBear.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Oceania. </color>
spirit_dropBear.spiritDescription: Do not mistake me for my gentle cousin, for I am not so meek. Please me and I serve as an able guardian of sacred places.

spirit_dryad.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_dryad.spiritDescription: I come of an old and noble race. Arbiters of the wood, I am made strong from the sinews of the forest. To serve as your protrectress you have much to prove.

spirit_edimmu.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Asia. </color>
spirit_edimmu.spiritDescription: We served the vanguard of the Ember Wars. Now, the sweet blood of witches cries to us once more.

spirit_indio.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_indio.spiritDescription: I am an ancestral guardian of brave adventurers. If you bore me, witch, I will find another.

spirit_evilWind.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_evilWind.spiritDescription: I am the Last of the Seven. I am the Storm, the Evil Wind, and I take my vengeance.

spirit_farDarrig.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_farDarrig.spiritDescription: I'm no chancer puttin on airs. I'm the original Red Man and up for layin boots on whoever stands before me.

spirit_fossegrimen.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_fossegrimen.spiritDescription: I am the water fiddler. Give me a satisfying meal and I will be happy to share the secrets of my melodies.

spirit_fowler.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Familiar. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Follows its summoner and attacks its enemies. </color>
 Commonly found:<color=#FFFFFF99> Worldwide. </color>
spirit_fowler.spiritDescription: I have served human witches for centuries. I am a keen and cunning protector, albeit with a mind of my own. I stand against demonkind, but it is the vampire that I truly loath.

spirit_fuath.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_fuath.spiritDescription: My name means "hate" in Scottish Gaelic. Assume my personality the same.

spirit_fudo.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_fudo.spiritDescription: I am the Immutable One. The wisdom of many years grants me patience. With my rope I bind the wicked.

spirit_fukusuke.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_fukusuke.spiritDescription: I am a princely agent of good fortune. Prosperity thrives in my presence. The ringing of the merchant's bell pleases me.

spirit_furiousWolf.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_furiousWolf.spiritDescription: I am the Fifth of the Seven. I am the Furious Wolf, who knoweth not flee. Challenge me, and see who is the last to make a stand.

spirit_gabija.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_gabija.spiritDescription: Regarded as the Lithuanian spirit of fire, I am the protector of home and family. I take many forms, most commonly a cat, stork, or rooster.

spirit_gashadokuro.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_gashadokuro.spiritDescription: I am the starving skeleton. Wander into my sight and I will feed on your blood.

spirit_glaistig.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_glaistig.spiritDescription: Don't confuse me with Fuath. I am beautiful yet also monstrous, the Green Lady with the lower end of a goat.

spirit_goatman.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_goatman.spiritDescription: I was once an esteemed scientist who fell victim to an experiment gone wrong. Now I'm cursed with the legs and head of a goat. Please don't come for me, for I wish to remain in isolation until my misery comes to an end.

spirit_greatDragon.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_greatDragon.spiritDescription: I am the Second of the Seven. I am the Great Dragon, whose mouth is wide open. None can measure to my true and raw strength.

spirit_leopard.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> The Middle East. </color>
spirit_leopard.spiritDescription: I am the Third of the Seven. I am the Grim Leopard, who carries off the young. Keep them safe and away from me, for I take any and everything in my sight.

spirit_grindylow.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_grindylow.spiritDescription: I am deeply misunderstund, for my old kinsman have stained my name. Call upon me and I shall prove myself a worthy companion to witches.

spirit_hitotsume.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_hitotsume.spiritDescription: I am the Japanese cyclops. Give me a block of tofu and I will forever be your friend.

spirit_houndAnnwn.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_houndAnnwn.spiritDescription: No longer in service of my old Lord Annwn, I am ready to lead your hunt. Let the night not hold us back, for we have the blessing of Matilda!

spirit_huldra.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Nordic Countries. </color>
spirit_huldra.spiritDescription: My long golden hair houses my crown of flowers. I promise you, I am beautiful, but so many can't look past my wretched cow's tail. Please, somebody wed me so I can be free of it.

spirit_hyosube.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_hyosube.spiritDescription: If I make my home in yours, prepare to clean up my grimey, mucky hair from your, now my, bathtub.

spirit_inugami.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_inugami.spiritDescription: Be careful not to mistake me from an ordinary canine. The level of loyalty I provide depends on the jingle of change in your pocket.

spirit_itzamna.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_itzamna.spiritDescription: Lord of Night and Day, I am the first healer and patron to the scribes. I have little time for upstart witches.

spirit_itzpapalotl.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_itzpapalotl.spiritDescription: I am the Obsidian Butterfly, made of the bones of Mictlan and ruler of the realm of Tamoanchan.

spirit_jackolantern.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_jackolantern.spiritDescription: Carve a happy face, carve a scary face, it doesn't matter to me. Use a candle or a light, on the porch or in the street. Just be sure to mutter the words, "Trick or Treat!"

spirit_jerseyDevil.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> North America. </color>
spirit_jerseyDevil.spiritDescription: The Pine Barrens of New Jersey is my home. I move quickly, and emit a blood-curdling scream unlike no other. Are you quick enough to catch me?

spirit_jikininki.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_jikininki.spiritDescription: I will smile when I am fat with the flesh and blood of all the dead.

spirit_jurupari.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_jurupari.spiritDescription: I am the Jurupari and you may find my words are as winding as the paths I hide beyond. You may never see my crooked smile, but you will feel it in your slumber.

spirit_kalku.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_kalku.spiritDescription: I am the dark shaman and the master of strife. If I am not enough to frighten you I can always introduce you to my servants Anchimayen and Chonchon.

spirit_kamaitachi.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_kamaitachi.spiritDescription: I am the sickle weasel. I attack in threes, so fast that death arrives before you see my spiny fur shift.

spirit_kappa.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_kappa.spiritDescription: I am the river child. I make my home in the ponds and streams, protecting the dish-like depression on my head. Let it go dry, and I will no longer serve you.

spirit_katawaguruma.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_katawaguruma.spiritDescription: I roll upon the roads of Japan on a flaming ox-cart wheel. Don't let my method of travel fool you. Get too close and I'll devour your soul.

spirit_kek.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Hunter. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Fights enemy and wild spirits it encounters. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Africa. </color>
spirit_kek.spiritDescription: I am not the frog you may be thinking of. I am the Egyptian representation of night and day. If you come here to converse about my representation in this new world, keep walking.

spirit_kesari.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_kesari.spiritDescription: I am a brave vanara once regarded as a chief. I am noted as the slayer of Shambasadana and will continue to challenge wicked monsters alike.

spirit_kijo.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Forbidden. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Dangerous to all. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_kijo.spiritDescription: Don't wonder into my mountains and caves. I will devour anything and anyone who sets foot in my territory.

spirit_kirin.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Assassin. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Attacks enemy witches with low energy. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_kirin.spiritDescription: You may only ever see me with the purest of heart. I will never appear to the wicked as I value life and purity above all else. If you find yourself consumed by my holy fire, yours is a truly dark heart.

spirit_kitsune.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Trickster. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Unpredictably casts a random spell on any witch. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Japan. </color>
spirit_kitsune.spiritDescription: I am the fox that punishes wicked holy men, the dishonest, and arrogance. Though, I may enjoy a friendly prank now and then.

spirit_lakshmi.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Healer. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Blesses its summoner and allies when their energy is low. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> India. </color>
spirit_lakshmi.spiritDescription: I am the goddess of wealth, fortune, and prosperity. Honor me and your burdens may disappear.

spirit_lalechusa.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> South America. </color>
spirit_lalechusa.spiritDescription: Don't believe in me? Whistle three times at the bell of midnight and you may find out.

spirit_lamia.spriitBehavior:
Type:<color=#FFFFFF99> Guardian. </color>
Behavior:<color=#FFFFFF99> Protects the location where it is summoned. </color>
Commonly found in:<color=#FFFFFF99> Europe. </color>
spirit_lamia.spiritDescription: Mothers beware, summon me and I may eat your children and steal your husbands.

spirit_lares.spriitBehavior:

lore_1.description: Chichen Itza is a large Mayan city, perhaps one of the great cities referred to as Tollans in Mesoamerican literature. Dominating the city center is El Castillo, or the temple of Kukulkan the feathered serpent deity. Plumed serpent sculptures grace the stairway of the northern balustrade. Visit during the spring or autumn equinox when the stepped pyramid casts triangular shadows making it look like the feathered serpent descending his temple.
lore_1.title: nThe Serpent Decentn
lore_1.value: nnTravel to Chichen Itza in Yucatan, Mexico.n

lore_2.description: The Cailleach Bheara is known by many names including the Bone Mother and Blue Hag, but whatever you choose to call her, she rules the winter and the Little Sun which shines from Samhain to Beltane. She is a weather goddess responsible for storms and continued winter until she hides her staff under a holly or gorse bush. Cairns, lochs, rivers, standing stones, and even mountains are said to be her work including Loch Awe near Dalavich, Scotland where legend has it, she allowed a well to overflow.
lore_2.title: nThe Blue Hag's Lochn
lore_2.value: Travel to Loch Awe near Dalavich, Scotland.

lore_3.description: Oil man W.B. Skirvin set out to build a premier hotel in Oklahoma City. It featured air conditioning, $100,000 Austrian crystal chandeliers and a ballroom for 500 people. Skirvin had an affair with a maid who became pregnant during the prohibition years. He kept her locked in an upper room to avoid scandal even after the child was born. Depressed and verging on insanity, the girl grabbed the child and plunged out a window to their deaths. Though the hotel has been closed and extensively remodeled, guests still encounter the maid's ghost and hear a crying child.
lore_3.title: Enjoy your Stay
lore_3.value: Travel to Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, United States

lore_4.description: Travel to Crater Lake in Oregon, the deepest lake in the United States, and one of the most pristine in the world. The Klamath and Modoc Indians have myths about how the lake and island were formed that actually formed some 7,000 years ago after a volcanic explosion of Mount Mazama. According to one legend La-o lord of the above world and Skell lord of the underworld battled until La-o was defeated and the island is all that remains of his body.
lore_4.title: Doomsday Crater
lore_4.value: Travel to Crater Lake, Oregon, United States

lore_5.description: Conquistadors searching for gold in the Amazon returned with tales of poisoned waters, man-eating snakes, and a river of boiling water. The Boiling River was long thought to be a Peruvian myth until a geothermal scientist tracked it down in 2011. Even though it's hundreds of miles from the nearest volcano, it is indeed boiling and is deadly for anyone or anything hapless enough to fall in. Considered sacred and linked to powerful jungle spirits, shamans are normally the only ones who approach it.
lore_5.title: Deadly Waters

lore_6.description: Brocken Mountain is afavorite haunt for witches since ancient times. It is here that a coven of Pythagorean disciples perfected the earliest forms of astral projection. We know them now as the first Greek shamans. Before their final soul-journey, they consecrated the Brocken as a bastion for all future magic workers. It served as a chosen staging ground for witches during the Ember Wars.
lore_6.title: nSending the Witch to Bloksbjergn

lore_7.description: At midnight in Galicia, Spain, everyone lights their bonfire to welcome the summer and celebrate St. John's Eve. The fires are a common theme throughout Europe and thought to rid a person or place of evil spirits and jumping over them brings good luck. Drink Queimada while chanting the spell that goes with it. Dance, share food, enjoy the fireworks. Women dip gathered herbs in sacred water and hang them over the doorway
lore_7.title: Lite the Bonfiren
lore_7.value: nTravel to  A Coruna, Galicia, Spainn

lore_8.description: nAs the legend goes, King Minos locked away the fearsome beast known as the Minotaur in an elaborate labyrinth. Aided by the king's daughter Ariadne who gave him a spool of thread to retrace his steps, Theseus killed the monster and escaped the labyrinth. Millenia later, scientists discovered an elaborate system of underground caverns twenty miles from the Knossos palace at Gortyn. The system is so complex, they used the same method of following twine to escape. The tunnels have been used for many things, including a Nazi ammunition dump, but did they first house a monster?
lore_8.title: A Forgotten Labrinth
lore_8.value: Travel to Knossos in Crete, Greece

lore_9.description: Legend states that in 1904, a bus transporting asylum patients crashed at Fairfax Bridge and all but Douglas Grifon were found. Reports of skinned rabbits hanging from trees traveled throughout the town and when a body was found in a similar fashion, officials named the killer â€œThe Bunny Man.â€ Now known as â€œThe Bunny Man Bridge,â€ there are countless reports of a man wandering in a white suit and bunny ears, axe in hand. Official reports show no proof of this legend but, to this day, rabbit carcasses are still found hanging on the overpass.
lore_9.title: Beware the Bunnyman
lore_9.value: Travel to Clifton, Virginia, United States

lore_10.description: Ghostly wails heard in the dead of night give â€œWoman Hollering Creekâ€ its name. The myth says that a woman, known as La Llorona in the Southeast, went insane and drowned her children after hearing of her husbandâ€™s affair. Realizing what she had done, she drowned herself, cursing herself to wander the waterways in search of her children. Be sure to keep your distance, lest she mistake you for one of her dead children.
lore_10.title: Don't get too Close
lore_10.value: Travel to Saint Hedwig, Texas, United States

lore_11.description: Summer solstice is celebrated in Romania on June 24 with Sanziene Eve. Women in traditional white dresses gather Sanziene flowers to weave into floral crowns. Come nightfall, maidens dance with their lovers around the bonfires, but they aren't the only dancers. The Sanziene, gentle fairies, also dance to bestow good fortune on people unless a man sees them. Then it is nothing but misfortune for him. At midnight the women throw their crowns on housetops for bountiful harvests. Herbs gathered and spells spoken on Sanzeine Eve are particularly powerful.
lore_11.title: Night of the Gentle Fairies
lore_11.value: Travel to Piatra Neamt near the Carpathian Mountains, Romania.

lore_12.description: Like Salem, Triora, Italy has a dark past with regard to witches. A famine spurred the witch trials and executions here during 1587-1589. Healers, herbalists, midwives, and many other innocent women were rounded up, tortured, and executed by the zealous Inquisition. Today, Triora embraces its ties to witchcraft. Visit the museum or LagodÃ©gnu, a small lake outside the city said to be a place of cleansing and power. The CampomavÃ¹e fountain, thought to be a gathering place for witches once, now claims healing powers.
lore_12.title: nHonor the Pastn

lore_13.description: According to legend, King Krakus sent his two sons to defeat a rampaging dragon near the Wawel castle. Unable to defeat him with might alone, they tricked the dragon into eating a calfskin filled with smoldering sulfur thereby vanquishing him. Today, visitors descend steep stairs to explore the Dragon's Lair. Nearby, archaeologists have located decapitated remains with the severed heads between their legs, which was thought to prevent vampirism.
lore_13.title: nA Vampire's Graven

lore_14.description: Wat Mahabut was originally built to honor a helpful monk. Today, it's famous for a tragic love story. Mae Nak was pregnant with their first child when Mak was conscripted in the army where he was seriously wounded. He returned home to his family not knowing they had perished during childbirth. Mae Nak, refusing to be bound by death, lived happily with him until he realized she was a ghost as his neighbors had warned him. He fled to Wat Mahabut to escape her wrath where she was eventually exorcised and has her own altar today. Leave a flower for Mae Nak for favor.
lore_14.title: A Ghost Bride's Shrine

lore_15.description: Zeus, the king of gods in Greek mythology, was preceded by five siblings who were all eaten by their father Kronos. Rhea bore Zeus secretly in the Dikteon Cave on the isle of Crete and left him in the care of a nymph. Hidden and protected, he grew until he was old enough to conquer his father and free his siblings. The cave was sacred to followers of Zeus for many centuries, but now you may visit and behold the magic firsthand.
lore_15.title: Zeus's Hideaway

lore_16.description: A nearby waterfall shares the name of an infamous terrifying local legend, La Ciguapa. Eyewitnesses say she is beautiful with black eyes and long dark hair that covers her body like a mantle. Shy and normally confined to the mountains, a Ciguapa isn't above luring a man to their lair where she mates and then devours them. Tracking them is difficult and dangerous since they have backward facing feet and looking at them directly can lead to enchantment.
lore_16.title: Don't Trust the Footprints
lore_16.value: Travel to Pico Duarte, Dominican Republic.

lore_17.description: A gnarled and ancient moss-covered oak stretches out in the Tuscan forest near Capannori, Italy. Locals believe the strangely flattened and twisted branches are from witches dancing in them and turning the tree into their own magical stage for myriad ceremonies. Let this 600-year-old monarch whisper to you of witches and watches over the centuries.
lore_17.title: Witches Gathering
lore_17.value: nTravel to Capannori, Province of Lucca, Italy n

lore_18.description: Travel to Huntsville, Alabama to join the restless spirits in the Dead Children's Playground. Most people wouldn't think about putting a children's playground next to a cemetery, but that's exactly what city planners did to the oldest cemetery in Alabama. Maybe they knew the children buried there over the years needed a place to play also and so they do.
lore_18.title: The Dead Children's Playground

lore_19.description: â€œWe bones, are here, waiting for yours.â€ When Evora, Portugal's two medieval cemeteries filled to overflowing, the Franciscan monks disinterred the bodies and built an ossuary. Over 5,000 remains contributed to the Gothic chapel of bones with its ornately vaulted ceilings and paintings intended to be a place of peaceful meditation.
lore_19.title: Chapel of Bones

lore_20.description: Golosov Ravine outside Moscow, Russia was once part of a royal estate. Now, it divides Kolomenskoye Park and visitors are invited to explore it if you dare. It's home to mystical springs, the Divity and Gus Rocks which radiate female and male energy. More intriguing are tales of time travel. In 1621, a Crimean cavalry from 1571 turned up in antiquated uniforms and equipment saying they had entered a green mist only minutes before, not fifty years. Others claim large, manlike beasts guide them through the green mists, if years later.
lore_20.title: Time Traveler's Path

lore_21.description: Karnataka, India is home to a malevolent spirit called the Nale Ba witch. When men began disappearing from villages, people believed it was her luring them away by calling out in the voice of a loved one. If they approached her or opened a door, she had them ensnared. Writing "Nale Ba" (come tomorrow) above doors and windows will thwart her, but beware walking at night when she's hunting, tomorrow may be here.
lore_21.title: Come Tomorrow
lore_21.value: Travel to Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh, India.

lore_22.description: Known as the olgoi-khorkhoi, or "Large Intestine Worm" to the natives, the more fancifully called Mongolian Death Worm calls the Gobi Desert home. It's red in color, two to seven feet long, legless, and thick. Natives swear it spits deadly venom and can cause electric shock. Like something out of a science fiction movie, rippling sands betray its movements underground. Tread carefully and avoid yellow, a color it's particularly attracted to.
lore_22.title: Deadly Desert
lore_22.value: Travel to The Flaming Cliffs in the Gobi Desert, Mongolia.

lore_23.description: El Sombreron, an infamous Guatemalan spirit wears a large sombrero, dresses in black, and moves from town to town with a pack of mules and a pair of chained dogs. When he finds a beautiful girl with long hair and big eyes, he serenades them with his silver guitar and enchanting songs only his victim can hear. The girl wastes away unable to sleep or eat because she always finds dirt in her food. Cutting off her hair and blessing it with holy water seems to be the only way to banish him.
lore_23.title: El Sombreron

lore_24.description: Though there are many tales and names of ghostly black dogs, the birthplace of England's Bargast is in the Yorkshire Dales National Park. The wild, windswept terrain dotted with craggy boulders is a perfect setting for a huntsman with his ghostly pack or a fearsome specter who may appear to guard travelers or warn of impending death. No wonder it's said to be the inspiration for the famed Hound of Baskervilles.
lore_24.title: The Spectral Hound

lore_25.description: Perhaps one of the greatest examples of how much people misunderstood Tuberculosis was poor Mercy Brown of Exeter Rhode Island. Two sisters died of TB in the 1880's before a brother, Edwin, fell ill in 1890. Mercy died in 1892. Rumors of vampires spread, and the two girls were disinterred. Mercy had never been buried due to the frozen ground and her body was in pristine condition, marking her as a vampire. They cut out her heart and burned it, but Edwin still died. Pay homage to the misidentified vampire.
lore_25.title: Eat her heart out.

lore_26.description: Cursed by a grieving king because she caused his son's death through witchcraft, Sihuanaba now wanders the countryside looking for her son and fresh victims. She may appear naked or in a filmy white gown and often sits, combing her beautiful long hair. Intrigued, men follow her into the wilderness where she reveals she has the head of a mare. The only way to escape madness is making the sign of the cross on her or biting your machete or knife, thus breaking her spell.
lore_26.title: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
lore_26.value: Travel to La Joya Forest, El Salvador.

lore_27.description: Kuchisake-onna, the slit-face woman, was once the beautiful wife of a powerful samurai. When he learned of her infidelity, he sliced her face from ear to ear with his sword. She committed suicide in despair and now wanders, asking people if she's pretty. With her lower face hidden, many people respond yes until she reveals the ghastly wound. Answer noncommittally or throw candy at her feet to escape this malevolent spirit. Thus distracted, you may escape her.
lore_27.title: Am I pretty?

lore_28.description: Kuchisake-onna, the slit-face woman, was once the beautiful wife of a powerful samurai. When he learned of her infidelity, he sliced her face from ear to ear with his sword. She committed suicide in despair and now wanders, asking people if she's pretty. With her lower face hidden, many people respond yes until she reveals the ghastly wound. Answer noncommittally or throw candy at her feet to escape this malevolent spirit. Thus distracted, you may escape her.
lore_28.title: nHealing Sunrise

lore_29.description: Umdlwenguli Obomvu is a legend that strikes fear in South Africa even today. Also known as Pinky Pinky, the creature is both male and female, light-skinned with pink eyes and preys on vulnerable young girls, but only if they're alone. The creature has been the subject of several investigations, including police where it's been sighted and accused of atrocities against the innocent. Don't listen to stories from a seemingly harmless pink-eyed woman. Umdlwenguli Obomvu always demands payment and not in the form of coin.
lore_29.title: Run while you can.
lore_29.value: Travel to Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

lore_30.description: Because of its early isolation the island of Chiloe is home to a unique selection of urban legends. The story of the brujos and the Imbunche is a very disturbing tale. Becoming a brujo means signing away your freedom and killing your loved ones. To protect their secrets and lair they created the Imbunche. Once a man, this creature is deformed by rituals now has the ability to turn a man to stone.
lore_30.title: Beware the Trolls
lore_30.value: Travel to Chonchi, Chiloe Island, Chile.

lore_31.description: Lake Derravaragh near Castlepollard, Ireland is home to the Legend of the Children of Lir. In order to appease King Lir, Bodb Derg who had been elected King in his stead, sent his daughter Aoibh to him to marry. They were very happy until she died after the birth of their twins. To console him, Bodb sent another daughter who was jealous of Lir's love for his four children and wanted Lir's love alone. Unable to kill them, she cursed them to become swans for nine-hundred years.
lore_31.title: The Four Swans

lore_32.description: A young bride was on her way to her wedding in a storm when disaster struck. One of the porters carrying her sedan chair lost his footing and the girl and her chair tumbled over the falls and into the lake below where she drowned. Some claim to see a young woman in a red cheongsam beside a pool brushing her hair. If you would approach her to ask a boon, beware, unexplained accidents occur here frequently.
lore_32.title: A Bride's Demise
lore_32.value: Travel to Bride's Pool, Hong Kong, China.

lore_33.description: Lake Lacar's pristine waters are normally so calm a person can see the slightest ripple caused by a bird or boat even at a distance. Sometimes, however, there's an unexplained disturbance and natives will tell you it is El Cuero, a monster resembling a flat cowhide or maybe an ancient stingray. It can surge out of the water to claim its victims with many sharp claws or grab them with its massive jaws and drag them back in the water to drown. Whatever it is, it is no friend to man.
lore_33.title: Lurking Beneath
lore_33.value: Travel to Lake Lacar, Andes Mountains, Argentina.

lore_34.description: To become a Navajo healer, the person must learn both good and evil magic to understand the full circle. Sometimes the draw of evil is too enticing, and the healer becomes the most evil of witches, a skin-walker who can take the form of an animal. They are very fast and powerful and completely without mercy. Avoid them if possible, but they may be defeated by repeating their full name if you've discovered their true identity.
lore_34.title: Skinwalkers

lore_35.description: An unknown man resembling a monkey started terrorizing citizens of New Delhi in 2001. Although he only attacks at night, varying accounts describe him as four feet tall, covered in fur, with large metal claws. Victims report being scratched and several deaths have been linked to this strange â€œMonkey-Man.â€ These accounts continue to confound the public, leading to extreme panic and paranoia.
lore_35.title: Kala Bandar

lore_36.description: Travel to Mangahurco, Ecuador for the rainy season in December, January, or February to watch the ancient guayacÃ¡n trees burst into brilliant golden bloom. It takes the trees 200 years to reach their fifty-foot mature height, so these are trees of power as well as beauty. Enjoy a treat called goat-in-the -hole or a chilled coconut drink while you take in the majesty of the valley that flows for miles with gold. Your opportunity is brief, lasting only a week once a year, but it's worth the visit.
lore_36.title: nBlooming Brightn

lore_37.description: No one knows the orgin of the spirit, Aka Manto, who is said to haunt the last stall of many bathrooms in Japan. When the stall is occupied, a disembodied voice will ask, â€œRed paper or blue?â€ If the person answers red, they will be violently attacked, their clothes turning red from blood. If their answer is blue, they will be strangled until they are blue in the face. The best chance of survival is to say â€œI donâ€™t need any paperâ€ and to run away before the spirit can attack.
lore_37.title: Red or Blue?

lore_38.description: Opened in 1885, the Princess Theater was the finest in Australia and rivaled many in the great capitols of the world. Frederick Baker, an English actor, so fell in love with Melbourne and the Princess, he moved there permanently and performed the greatest plays of the time. In a final scene as Mephistopheles in Faust, he is lowered through a trap door and died of a heart attack. It didn't keep his ghost from taking a bow at the end. The theater keeps an empty chair in the audience for him, though he's often seen on stage as if he's about to go on.
lore_38.title: A Ghosty Guest of Honor.

lore_39.description: El SilbÃ³n is a malevolent spirit wandering the Venezuelan plains, but once he was simply a very spoiled son. One day he became enraged at his father and killed him, then took the entrails back to his mother to cook. She became suspicious and went looking for her husband where she discovered the awful truth. Aghast, the grandfather tied him up and beat him then cursed him to roam with a sack containing his father's remains and forever hounded by spectral dogs who won't let him rest. Also known as The Whistler, he can be avoided if you hear his distinctive whistling.
lore_39.title: Listen for a Whistle

lore_40.description: There are several sights in the English Midlands for an inquisitive witch to investigate. The Druid Stone in Nottinghamshire is a natural formation with an entry carved through the middle. The opening orientation coincides with the celebration of Beltane or May Day sunrise. Walking through or passing a sick child through is said to cure illness.
lore_40.title: nA Gate Betweenn

lore_41.description: A grassy hill overlooking the Fiagdon River is home to a small, medieval village of white houses stepping their way toward the mountains. It's secluded and peaceful and centuries old, but no living soul has ever resided within these walls. Some of the houses have two or three stories or underground vaults to house generations of family members who were entombed in small boat-like caskets. Drop a coin in one of the wells. Perhaps one of the spirits will commune.
lore_41.title: The City of the Dead

lore_42.description: Qiandao Lake, or the lake of a thousand islands, is home to a watery treasure. In 1959, the Chinese government completed a dam that flooded the area, creating the lake. At the foot of Five Lions Mountain is 2,000-year-old Lion City. The deep waters have preserved the city even to the woodwork and intricate carvings and statuary. Perhaps Gonggong, the red-haired dragon responsible for great floods has taken up residence in the ancient city.
lore_42.title: Dive for Treasure
lore_42.value: Travel to Xin'anjiang Reservoir, Hangzhou, China.

lore_43.description: Years ago, Don Julian Santana Barrera, found a little girl who drowned in mysterious circumstances. Some days after he found the girl, he found a doll floating in the water nearby and put it in a tree to bring peace to her spirit. Those close to him say it had a profound impact. Over fifty years, he continued collecting dolls and putting them around the floating garden until they are everywhere you look. He eventually died in the same spot where the girl was found, but visitors to the Island of the Dolls still leave dolls in remembrance.
lore_43.title: Doll Island

lore_44.description: Travel to the Witch House in Salem, Massachusetts, the last surviving structure with ties to the infamous witch trials. The house belonged to Judge Jonathan Corwin who presided over the trials in 1692 after the previous magistrate resigned following the execution of Bridget Bishop. Thus began the worst witch hunt in United States history resulting in nineteen deaths and dozens of accusations.
lore_44.title: The Last Home

lore_45.description: Gashadokuro are made from the bones of soldiers who were lost to famine and never buried. The creature was originally created by a war chiefâ€™s daughter as a last resort to save their tribe from an attack. Their hunger follows them into the afterlife, causing them to rise up to form this bloodthirsty, 90 foot tall beast. Although they are invisible until the moment of attack, you will hear a ringing in your ear when the monster is near. Be on alert, escape is the only way to survive.
lore_45.title: Starving Skeleton

LoadingTips.value: Wild spirits are located around the world in their native environment.
Defeating wild spirits will give you the knowledge required to summons them for your bidding.
You can summon more than one spirit at the time.
Summoning spirits while controlling a Place of Power is instant, and costs no energy.
Spirits summoned within a Place of Power stay and defend the PoP from attack.
The Spirit Deck will display all of the spirits that a witch has learned how to summon.
To summon a spirit will require you possess the right tool.
Defeated spirits will often drop tools required to summon them.
Beware. Some spirits are not happy to be summoned.
Hunting wild spirits is a good way to earn silver.
Savannah Grey blesses witches each day by restoring their base energy level.
Base energy for a witch starts at 10000 and increases by 1000 with each experience level gained.
Your energy cap is the maximum amount of energy that you may possess. This grows along with your level.
Zero energy causes a death state.
While in death state, most actions are restricted.
A witches energy must rise above zero to exit the death state.
To defeat an opponent, use spells and drop their energy to zero.
Elixir of Invisibility and True Sight can be purchased with silver from Madam Fortuna.
Elixir of Alignement and Experience can be purchased with silver from Madam Fortuna.
The Elixir of Invisibility stops working once a witch does witchy things.
The Elixir of Invisibility continues working while a witch is in flight.
True Sight elixirs allow you to see through invisibility.
The Elixir of Alignment increases the effect your spells have on your alignment.
Elixir of Experience increases the experience gained from all sources.
If you're running low on silver visit Madam Fortuna's shop.
Visit Madam Fortuna to shop for your wardrobe.
Madam Fortuna has many curious goods to trade with witches.
Silver Drachs are the main currency in the world of Covens.
Gold Drachs are very rare, and can only be earned from certain Places of Power and Daily Achievements.
Ingredients can be added to spells for greater results.
Adding the wrong combination of ingredients to a spell will backfire.
Spells are divided into three schools of magic, Light, Gray and Shadow, and casting them aligns a witch to those schools.
All members of a coven gain the benefits of a Place of Power controlled by their coven.
A coven can have up to 13 members before it must convert to a hive.  A hive may consist of hundreds of witches.
A witch does not need to join a coven, but the power of a well maintained coven is desirable to most.
A witch can send a request to other witches to join a coven or hive.
A witch can only belong to one coven at the time.
Use World or Dominion chat to talk with a witch outside of your coven.
Witches are more powerful when witches from their coven are near. This power increases with every nearby covenmate.
The event log describes all things that happen while you're witching.
A witch can choose to complete daily objectives and receive rewards for their effort.
Madam Fortuna sells bundles of various ingredients used in witchcraft.
A witch can assume astral form and fly anywhere in the world, but the further from their physical body, the weaker they become.
Some Places of Power can only be entered while in physical form.
Casting on another witch will alert them of the attack.
After hunting the globe in astral form, use the recall button to return to your physical location.
Phases of the moon affect a witches energy and power based on their alignment.
To prepare for the Ember Days, witches compete in seasonal tournaments of witchcraft that are tied to Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter.
Push notifications from Covens can be turned On/Off in the settings screen.
Visit the Witch School located within the settings screen to accelerate your education.

SHN.value: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

SGS.value: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
